definition: in doubt/unsure of sth/unable to decide/indecisive
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: You'd better consult the exposure meter if you are not sure of the time for exposure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你拿不准曝光时间，最好查一下曝光表。
我也有点拿不准，先借1000美元吧。

sentences.english: If in doubt, the arrow is safer.
sentences.chinese: 如果拿不准，那么使用箭头更安全。

sentences.english: The boss was not sure about his fitness for the job.
sentences.chinese: 关于这份工作，老板拿不准他是否做得来。

sentences.english: The doctor doubted whether the patient would live through that month.
sentences.chinese: 医生拿不准那个病人是否能活过那个月。

sentences.english: When in doubt, seek professional help.
sentences.chinese: 如果拿不准，要向专业人士寻求帮助。

definition: to be unsure about a matter/to be uncertain/to be unable to make sense of sth
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
to hesitate over what move to make (idiom); to waver/to shilly-shally
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to be unable to guess or make out
